JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Research Assistant for liquid mushroom fermentation
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The research group Plant Based Food and Biochemistry at the Department of Food Science is looking for an engaged research assistant. The position is for 18 months, with start 1st of August 2022.

The Department of Food Science at the University of Copenhagen (UCPH FOOD) strives to be internationally recognised for excellence in food research and education, with an impact for consumers, industry and society. It contributes to the production of sustainable and healthy food by:

  • Creating the fundamental knowledge for a secure and sustainable future food supply of high quality (safe, nutritious, tasty)
  • Reducing the environmental impact of food production through research in the production of sustainable proteins and consumer preferences
  • Developing green food production systems through research in responsible and sustainable production methods and by digitalization of the food manufacturing chain
The position is related to the project “Mushroom fermentation of side streams from food industry”. The purpose of the project is to convert industrial plant waste streams from sugar production into fungal mycelium (Oyster Mushroom, Pleourotus Ostreatus). The fungal product will subsequently be included as protein ingredient / component in foods. Here it will contribute significantly to reduce resource consumption, increase the quality of plant-based meat substitute and could help replace meat production and thus lower greenhouse gases.

Further information on the Department is linked at http://www.science.ku.dk/english/about-the-faculty/organisation/. Inquiries about the position can be made to Associate Professor René Lametsch.

The position is open from August 1st 2022.

The University wishes our staff to reflect the diversity of society and thus welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.

Job description
As our research assistant, you will carry out a number of routine laboratory tasks, but you are also expected to have an independent overview of the general operations and maintenance of the laboratory. You will be responsible for the daily organization of the research laboratory and independently coordinate and plan tasks supporting experiments.

You will also have the following responsibilities:

  • Be responsible for the food grade fermentation laboratory
  • Fermentation of fungal mycelium
  • Support students in the research laboratories and participate in teaching activities in relation to courses in biochemistry and plant based foods
  • Analysis and evaluation of data obtained during fermentation
  • Conduct extraction and analysis of selected compounds from plant seeds and fungal mycelium
With your technical expertise, you will assist other members of the group on their research projects. We look for somebody with an accurate and reliable record keeping including database management who adheres to all safety policies.

We would like to welcome a person with a friendly and supportive attitude that will become an important and central member of our research group.

Profile:

Master degree within natural or veterinary science is required for the position.

Your experience/qualifications should include the following:

  • Solid previous experience in a research laboratory
  • Proven experience in liquid mushroom fermentation
  • Proven experience in the use of bioreactors for liquid and solid-state fermentation
  • Experience with extraction and analysis of different compounds, e.g. vicine/convicine and chitin
  • You must have good interpersonal skills and interest in working in an international team
  • Strong organizational skills and analytical mindset to independently plan and carry out the laboratory tasks
  • Precise and structured working attitude
  • Accurate record-keeping of laboratory procedures
  • Knowledge of safe laboratory procedures
  • Good English communication skills, both oral and written, are prerequisite for the successful candidate
  • Should hold a master degree in natural science
We offer a professional, dynamic and international research environment, where we largely communicate in English in the laboratories, in project descriptions and in meetings. The laboratories have Bachelor, Master and PhD students as well as guest researchers, therefore you must be able to read instructions and supervise within your area of expertise in English. Our work environment includes independence and teamwork, social activities and an appreciative approach with colleagues.

Terms of employment

The position is covered by the Memorandum on Job Structure for Academic Staff.

Terms of appointment and payment according to the agreement between the Ministry of Finance and The Danish Confederation of Professional Associations on Academics in the State.

Negotiation for salary supplement is possible.

Questions
For further information about the position please contact Associate professor René Lamesch (rla@food.ku.dk )

Application
The application, in English, must be submitted electronically by clicking APPLY NOW below.

Please include

  • Curriculum vitae
  • Diploma and transcripts of records (BSc and MSc)
  • Publication list
After the expiry of the deadline for applications, the authorized recruitment manager selects applicants for assessment on the advice of the Interview Committee.

You can read about the recruitment process at http://employment.ku.dk/faculty/recruitment-process/.

Interviews will be held in week 21.
